attributes.action: Parliament  does not invoke article 50 to leave the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
1. When any organisation wishes to change something significant such as its constitution,  it normally needs a 75% or more majority of eligible voters rather than a simple 51% majority or voters.
2. Any vote should be to leave in principle, based on a detailed plan prepared by the Leave side and Government and stakeholders. It is naïve and foolish to vote on a plan that does not exist. 
3. Its clear that both campaigns misled the population:  fo the contribution of £350bn a week  will not go to the NHS, immigration will not change. 

The electorate did not have the information to make an informed decision.
attributes.background:
In the  Brexit vote, of a population of 65million, only 17,410,742 voted to leave. There are 3 reasons to put the result aside:
1. Constitutional changes should need a 75% majority
2. A detailed exit plan with the EU needs to be available  before the vote
3.  Both sides lied
